Legal_Issue: Credibility assessment, subjective fear of persecution
Credibility_Assessment: Board found credibility issues, including misinterpretation of a letter
Evidence_Type: Personal affidavit, documentary evidence (letter), delay in claim
Legal_Provision: Section 96 and Section 97 of the Immigration and Refugee Protection Act
Evaluation_Standard: Subjective fear and objective risk of persecution
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of recent threats since 2007 indicating no ongoing risk
Application_Error: Misinterpretation of letter, failure to properly assess reasons for delay
Evidence_Ignored: Reasons for delay in making the claim
Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board of Canada
Decision_Review_Issue: Error in credibility and subjective fear assessment
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Section 96
Outcome_of_Review: Dismissed – no reversible error due to lack of current threat
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of objective basis for fear despite credibility concerns
Evidentiary_Issues: Credibility doubts, unexplained delay, lack of corroborating evidence
Procedural_Fairness: Assessed – no breach found despite errors
Credibility_Issues: Yes – misinterpreted letter and implausibility regarding delay
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimant challenged reasonableness of Board's decision
